operation.descriptionCdata:
cc26d117-d56c-415f-aa4d-22b693ed76ea.description=Accepts an object in the JavaScript Object Notation format (JSON) and returns a value for the specified key.

The JSON format encodes objects as a set of unordered key/value pairs, which is similar to a structure or map in other programming languages. 
 For example\:
 { "city" \: "Palo Alto", 
 "state" \: "CA" }
is an object with two elements one with the name "city" having the value "Palo Alto", and the other being the name "state" with the value "CA". 
This operation would return "Palo Alto" if user enters "city" as a key.

If the input object contains JSON array, array index can be used in the key input. For example, 
{ "location"\: [
 {"city"\: "Roseville", "country"\: "United States"},
 {"city"\: "Cluj", "country"\: "Romania"},
 {"city"\: "Yehud", "country"\: "Israel"}] 
}
The operation would return "Roseville" if user enters "location[0].city" as a key.

If the key name of an object contains "." e.g. system.property.wide, it should be povided with quotes \: "system.property.wide".

JavaScript objects are useful for representing structured data, and are especially when used within an array. For example, an operation that retrieves
a set of incidents from an external system may return the entire list in one array of incident objects. The description of the enclosing folder,
/Library/Utility Operations/Container/JSON has more examples, and the JSON format is described completely at http\://www.json.org.

Inputs\:
 object - The JavaScript object. The operation will return a failure if it is not a JavaScript object.
 key - The key in the object to get the value of.

Responses\:
 success - The value was successfully returned for the specified key. 
 failure - There was some error in processing the object, most likely because the object is not in valid JSON or the specified key does not exist in the object. 
 You may wish to use a tool such as http\://www.jsonlint.com/ to help diagnose problems with JavaScript Object Notation.

Results\:
 returnResult - The primary output will be the value for the specified key in the object.

Note\:
 If the value in JSON object is in scientific notation, the returned output will be converted to an equivalent decimal number. Ex, 2.9e+1 will be converted to 29.
operation.name: Get Value from Object
